Eligible: Any graduate or Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) with valid RN license or equivalent healthcare administration experience
job_summary: The Health Admin Services Associate supports clinical and client teams to optimize healthcare member outcomes, manage claims administration, verify benefits, and ensure adherence to medical policies. The role focuses on providing administrative support for pre-certifications, case reviews, claims processing, and utilization management in line with healthcare compliance standards.
role_detailes: Manage inbound and outbound calls, e-reviews, and faxes related to healthcare claim administration.
Verify eligibility, benefits, and provider information in client systems and ensure prompt response to service requests.
Conduct provider searches and follow up on referrals or pre-authorizations as required.
Perform data entry of requests into client systems and route cases appropriately.
Match clinical records, generate approval letters, and consolidate input data for case approvals.
Assign and manage workflow tasks within client systems to ensure service-level adherence.
Refer clinical cases to nurse reviewers after ensuring data completeness and correctness.
Conduct outbound calls to collect missing clinical information or confirm authorizations.
Assist with post-service claims using benefit contracts and health plan guidelines.
Maintain administrative inventories and task lists as directed by team leads and operations managers.
Support clinicians with case preparation, contact verification, and documentation checks.
Follow regulatory timeframes, prioritize daily tasks, and ensure compliance with SOPs.
Provide strong customer service with attention to detail and empathy during patient or provider communications.
Comply with shift schedules, including rotating or night shifts as per process requirements.
Note: This role may require rotational shifts. Candidates should have experience in claims processing, healthcare operations, or nursing. Familiarity with ICD-9/ICD-10 and CPT codes is preferred.
mandatory: Bachelor’s degree or Nursing qualification with 1-3 years of experience in healthcare, claims, or administrative support functions.
skills_expected: Knowledge of ICD and CPT codes

job_role: Customer Contact Comms New Associate - Voice
Eligible: Any graduate with strong verbal communication and customer engagement skills
job_summary: The Customer Contact Communications New Associate - Voice role focuses on handling inbound customer service interactions across voice channels. This includes resolving inquiries, addressing complaints, and ensuring timely issue resolution within service level agreements while maintaining high satisfaction levels.
role_detailes: Handle inbound customer calls and provide support for queries, complaints, and service-related issues.
Resolve customer escalations promptly within defined SLA timelines.
Communicate politely and effectively with customers to ensure a positive experience.
Document issues and resolutions accurately within internal CRM tools.
Collaborate with team members and supervisors to improve service delivery.
Follow detailed instructions and established processes to manage customer interactions.
Escalate unresolved or complex cases to higher-level teams when necessary.
Maintain sensitivity to customer concerns and follow company guidelines.
Work as an individual contributor within a structured and closely supervised environment.
Be flexible to work in rotational shifts, including weekends or late hours.
Note: This position requires excellent spoken English, typing skills, and familiarity with basic customer support metrics. Candidates may be expected to handle voice, email, or chat channels as per business requirements.
mandatory: Any graduate fresher or up to 1 year of experience in a voice-based process with good communication and problem-solving abilities.

Eligible: B.Com or Qualified Chartered Accountant (CA) with 1-3 years of experience in financial reporting or management
job_summary: The Record to Report Operations Associate supports financial operations by performing journal entry posting, balance sheet reconciliations, cash forecasting, and month-end closing activities. The role includes analyzing financial reports, supporting audits, and implementing tools for enhanced financial accuracy and efficiency.
role_detailes: Collect and analyze operational data to determine financial outcomes and prepare detailed reports.
Post journal entries and prepare balance sheet reconciliations to ensure data accuracy.
Support preparation of cash forecasting statements and assist with month-end closing processes.
Review entries, reconciliations, and ensure compliance with audit requirements.
Assist in developing tools and processes to enhance clients’ financial analysis capabilities.
Use financial ratios to assess materiality, volatility, and overall financial health.
Create solutions for complex financial challenges requiring in-depth variable analysis.
Interact with senior management internally and externally to align financial strategy.
Manage medium to large-sized teams or projects independently.
Adhere to strategic goals and operate autonomously in decision-making for assigned areas.
Note: This role may require working in rotational shifts. Candidates should have prior experience in financial reporting or management accounting, and possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
mandatory: B.Com degree or CA qualification with 1-3 years of relevant experience. Prior exposure to external financial or group reporting preferred.

job_summary: Aligned with Finance Operations vertical to support financial outcomes through vendor invoice and payment processing, reconciliations, audit compliance, and ensuring accurate accounting across procure-to-pay activities.
role_detailes: Process vendor invoices and credit notes within agreed timelines.
Validate and identify non-compliant invoices, raising queries to stakeholders.
Perform vendor reconciliations, GRIR reconciliations, and month-end tasks.
Process PO invoices (2-way/3-way match) and Non-PO invoices with required approvals.
Conduct duplicate payment audit checks and root cause analysis.
Manage payment runs, urgent payments, and vendor refunds.
Ensure controls, compliance, audit readiness, and documentation are maintained.
Coordinate with Vendor Master and Banking teams for issue resolution.
Note: Candidate must be ready to work night shifts and should have good knowledge of MS Excel and Procure-to-Pay domain systems.
skills_expected: Month End Close tasks in Procure to Pay
Experience in Great Plains, AS400 & Navision

job_summary: Aligned with Finance Operations vertical, this role involves supporting end-to-end Record to Report processes such as journal entry posting, balance sheet reconciliations, cash forecasting, month-end closing, and audit support to ensure accuracy and compliance in financial reporting.
role_detailes: Post journal entries and manage bookkeeping activities.
Prepare and review balance sheet reconciliations.
Support cash forecasting and reporting activities.
Assist in variance analysis and provide comments for trial balance movements.
Perform intercompany, FA, and lease-related activities.
Support month-end closing, including reconciliations and reporting.
Ensure compliance with controls and assist in audits.
Collaborate with stakeholders and team members to manage deliverables.
May require rotational shifts as per business requirements.
Note: Candidate should have strong knowledge of accounting fundamentals, general ledger, reconciliations, and be flexible to work in rotational shifts.

job_summary: As part of the Finance Operations vertical, this role focuses on risk management in finance and accounting. Responsibilities include analyzing operational data, assessing and mitigating risks, supporting general accounting practices, and applying agile-based risk management approaches to ensure continuous project delivery.
role_detailes: Assist in identifying, categorizing, and mitigating potential risks in financial processes and projects.
Collect operational data and reports for analysis and reconciliation of transactions.
Support general accounting practices under supervision.
Apply agile risk management practices within project roles, artifacts, and workflows.
Contribute to contingency planning and issue resolution to minimize financial risk.
Perform routine problem-solving with close supervision.
Collaborate with the team and direct supervisor for assigned tasks.
Act as an individual contributor within a narrow scope of work.
May be required to work in rotational shifts.
Note: This is an entry-level position, suitable for fresh graduates who wish to gain exposure in Finance Operations and Risk Management.

job_summary: Aligned with the Customer Support vertical to manage and resolve customer queries, handle escalations and complaints, and ensure closure of issues within SLA timelines through effective communication over multiple channels.
role_detailes: Resolve routine customer queries and escalations through chat, email, calls.
Handle dissatisfied customers and provide best-in-class resolutions.
Close customer complaints and faults within defined SLA timelines.
Communicate with customers across multiple channels such as phone, chat, email, and face-to-face where required.
Collaborate with the team and supervisor for guidance and escalation handling.
Work as an individual contributor focused on clear scope work tasks.
Adhere to detailed instructions for new assignments and standard procedures.
Note: Candidate must be open to working in rotational shifts and should be good at email, chat handling, and typing.
skills_expected: Ability to work well in a team
Typing efficiency (preferred for chat and email processes)

job_summary: Support business operations by assisting with measurement frameworks, reporting, and ensuring accurate data analysis for performance tracking.
role_detailes: Assist in preparing business performance reports.
Ensure data accuracy and process adherence.
Collaborate with internal teams to gather metrics and KPIs.
Build dashboards and support reporting automation projects.
Note: Freshers and candidates up to 2 years’ experience are eligible.

job_summary: As an Application Tech Support Practitioner, you will act as the interface between clients and systems/applications, ensuring smooth operations, addressing client issues, and leveraging strong communication skills to deliver reliable technical support and maintain system performance.
role_detailes: Provide Level 1 (L1) Technical Support through the IT Service Desk.
Assist users in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues efficiently.
Log and document client interactions, issues, and resolutions in the ITSM tool.
Collaborate with team members to improve service delivery and enhance client experience.
Note: Candidate must be flexible to work in 24x7 rotational shifts including nights, weekends, and Indian public holidays.
mandatory: Readiness for 24x7 rotational night shifts from office
skills_expected: ITSM tools like ServiceNow, BMC Remedy
Understanding of SLAs and ticket lifecycle
Remote user support via troubleshooting tools
Excellent verbal communication with neutral accent
Ability to handle irate customers under pressure
skills: Email, chat, and remote desktop assistance
Strong written and verbal client communication

job_summary: As an Application Tech Support Practitioner, this role acts as the vital link between clients and the systems or applications used, ensuring seamless system operation and client satisfaction through excellent communication and technical support.
role_detailes: Provide Level 1 (L1) Technical Support through the IT Service Desk.
Assist users in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues efficiently and effectively.
Log and document client interactions, issues, and resolutions in the ITSM tool.
Collaborate with team members to improve service delivery and overall client experience.
Note: Role involves 24x7 support with 9.5-hour rotational shifts including US/night shifts, weekends, and Indian public holidays. Work is from office.
mandatory: Flexibility to work night shifts and rotational shifts as per roster
skills_expected: Experience with ITSM tools like ServiceNow, BMC Remedy
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 (O365), MS Office Suite
Understanding of SLAs and ticket lifecycle
Excellent verbal communication with neutral accent
Strong written communication and proper email etiquette
Ability to stay calm under pressure with irate customers and high call volumes
skills: Email, chat, and remote desktop support

job_summary: As a Trust & Safety Associate, you will be responsible for analyzing and reviewing user profiles, audio, video, and text-based content, investigating issues flagged by users or systems, and ensuring a secure and positive online environment while adhering to client guidelines.
role_detailes: Review, classify, and/or remove content according to client guidelines using specific tools and channels.
Analyze and investigate sensitive or objectionable content, ensuring compliance with policies.
Escalate complex content issues to the Trust & Safety team.
Remain updated on evolving client policies and moderation standards.
Ensure decisions are objective and free from personal bias.
Safeguard user experience while upholding platform safety.
Note: The role involves exposure to potentially sensitive or objectionable content (e.g., graphic, violent, sexual). Emotional resilience, stress-management skills, and participation in well-being support programs are essential.
mandatory: Strong coping, emotional resilience, and stress-management skills
skills_expected: Ability to establish strong client relationships
Objective decision-making devoid of personal biases
Attention to detail and information analysis
2-3 years of customer support experience via phone, email, and chat
Experience in B2C (B2B knowledge is an advantage)
Customer service mindset with focus on customer experience

job_summary: As an Application Tech Support Practitioner, act as the ongoing interface between the client and systems/applications, using exceptional communication skills to ensure smooth system functioning and timely resolution of client issues.
role_detailes: Lead and manage high-severity incidents affecting SAP's cloud environments with rapid coordination and escalation.
Serve as central point of contact during major incidents ensuring collaboration across teams.
Use ServiceNow, cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), and monitoring tools for incident management.
Conduct post-incident reviews and collaborate for root cause analysis and problem management.
Prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively with attention to business continuity and operational resilience.
Note: Requires minimum 5 years of experience in infrastructure service management and preferably ITIL Foundation certification. Based in Bengaluru office with 15 years full-time education requirement.
mandatory: Minimum 5 years of experience in infrastructure service management

job_role: Deal Structuring and Pricing Associate Manager
location: Gurugram, Mumbai, Bangalore, Pune, Kolkata, Jaipur, Hyderabad, Ahmedabad, Indore
job_summary: Provide professional financial and commercial leadership, focused on development and approval of complex deals ensuring financial accuracy and compliance.
role_detailes: Perform analytical reviews of client budget and identify missing information.
Use costing information and deal parameters to calculate price and margin with internal pricing tools.
Assist deal teams to analyze financial risks, mitigation, and opportunities.
Ensure US GAAP compliance and coordinate with tax/legal teams for tax efficiency and legality.
Present financial context to influence deal shaping and client negotiations.
Escalate poor financial metric deals and improve financial quality before moving forward.
Commit to continuous learning and contribute to Deal Structuring knowledge capital.
skills_expected: Deal Pricing in IT Service industry
